1472.01 ADOPTION OF INSPECTION PLANS.
   The City of Ravenna is hereby authorized and directed to develop and adopt
plans for the inspection of dwelling units subject to the provisions of this
Code, including, but not limited to:
   (a)   A plan for the periodic inspection of all residential rental
dwellings, rooming houses and dormitories.
   (b)   A plan for the systematic inspection of all premises within the City
of Ravenna subject to the provisions of Chapter
1488 - Exterior Property Maintenance.
   (c)   A program whereby any property owner or operator, prior to entering
into a contract for the sale of any dwelling in the City of Ravenna, may
request and obtain from the City of Ravenna, a report, issued by the Property
Maintenance Officer, based on an inspection of such dwelling, pursuant to the
provisions of this Code.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.02 AUTHORITY TO MAKE INSPECTIONS.
   The City of Ravenna shall enforce the provisions of this Code and is hereby
authorized and directed to make inspections pursuant to one or more of the
plans for inspection authorized by Section
1472.01, or in response to a complaint that an alleged violation of the
provisions of this Code or of applicable rules issued pursuant thereto may
exist, or when the City of Ravenna has a valid reason to believe that a
violation of this Code or any rules issued pursuant thereto has been or is
being committed.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.03 RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   (a)   The City of Ravenna is hereby authorized to inspect all dwellings
subject to the provisions of this Code, at any reasonable time and upon twenty-
four hours notice, for the purpose of determining whether there is compliance
with its provisions.
   (b)   The City of Ravenna is hereby authorized to inspect the premises
surrounding any structure subject to this Code, for the purpose of determining
whether there is compliance with its provisions.
   (c)   If any owner, occupant or other person in charge of a dwelling or
premises subject to the provisions of this Code refuses or in any manner
interferes or restricts free access to any part of the dwelling or premises for
inspection, the City of Ravenna may seek, in a court of competent jurisdiction,
an order authorizing such inspection as follows:
      (1)   If the owner, occupant, or agent thereof does not consent to the
proposed inspection, the code official may appear before any judge in a court
of competent jurisdiction and seek an administrative search warrant to allow an
inspection. Any such application shall be made within ten calendar days after
the non-consent. The application for the warrant shall specify the basis upon
which the warrant is being sought and shall include a statement that the
inspection will be limited to a determination whether there are violations of
the code provisions identified in this section. The court may consider any of
the following factors along with such other matters as it deems pertinent in
its decision as to whether a warrant shall be issued:
         A.   Eyewitness account of violation;
         B.   Citizen complaints;
         C.   Tenant complaints;
         D.   Plain view violations;
         E.   Violations apparent from City records;
         F.   Property deterioration;
         G.   Age of property;
         H.   Nature of alleged violation.
   (d)   If a warrant is issued, no owner, occupant, or agent thereof shall
fail or neglect, upon presentation of a warrant, to properly permit entry
therein by the code official or his/her duly authorized designee for the
purpose of conducting a rental inspection and examination pursuant to this
section and consistent with the terms of the warrant.
      (1)   If an administrative order is ignored, the City will file through
the court for a motion of contempt.
      (2)   If a warrant is issued and upon inspection violation(s) found, the
City may petition the court for administrative expenses incurred with
appropriate expenses awarded to the City. Expenses incurred may be but are not
limited to staff wages per hour, court cost, inspection fees and other costs
associated with seeking the administrative warrant.
         (Ord. 2021-035. Passed 6-7-21.)
1472.04 RESPONSIBILITY OF OCCUPANTS TO GIVE ACCESS TO OWNERS AND OPERATORS.
   Every occupant of a dwelling, dwelling unit or premises shall give the owner
or operator thereof access to any part of such dwelling, dwelling unit or
premises, at reasonable times, for the purpose of making such inspections or
repairs as may be necessary to comply with provisions of this Code.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.05 CONFIDENTIALITY OF EVIDENCE. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Section 1472.05 was repealed by Ordinance No. 2021-035,
passed June 7, 2021.)
1472.06 RESPONSIBILITY OF PROPERTY MAINTENANCE OFFICER.
   It shall be the responsibility and duty of the Property Maintenance Officer
to enforce and administer the provisions of the Code.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.07 VARIANCES.
   (a)   When there are practical difficulties involved in carrying out
structural or mechanical provisions of this Code or of any approved rule, the
Property Maintenance Officer may vary or modify any such provision or rule upon
application of the owner or the owner's representative, provided that the
spirit and intent of the law shall be observed and public welfare and safety
assured.
   (b)   The application for modification and the final decision of the
Property Maintenance Officer shall be in writing and shall be officially
recorded in the permanent records.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.08 NOTICE OF VIOLATION.
   (a)   Where a violation of this Code is found to exist, a written notice
from the Property Maintenance Officer shall be served upon the person or
persons responsible for the correction thereof. Such notice shall specify the
violation committed and a reasonable period of time to correct or abate such
violation.
   (b)   Service of such notice shall be by Regular U.S. Mail, personal service
or certified mail addressed to the owner or responsible party at his or her
residence or to the tax mailing address as indicated by the records of the
County Treasurer.
(Ord. 2017-036. Passed 3-6-17.)
1472.09 EXTENSION OF TIME TO CORRECT VIOLATIONS.
   Where the owner of a premises is unable to comply with a notice of violation
within the time period specified, the owner, within fourteen days of the notice
of nonconformance, may enter into an agreement with the Property Maintenance
Officer detailing a program to abate nonconformance within a reasonable time
limit.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.10 CORRECTIVE ACTION; REPAIRS.
   Whenever an owner, operator or agent of a dwelling or premises fails,
neglects or refuses to make repairs or other corrective action called for by
the order or notice of violation issued pursuant to Section
1472.08, the Property Maintenance Officer may undertake such repairs or action
when, in his or her judgment, a failure to make them will endanger the public
health, safety or welfare, or when a court orders him or her to do so. The cost
of such repairs and action will not exceed fifty percent of the fair market
value of the structure to be repaired.
   When repairs are made or other corrective action taken at the direction of
the Property Maintenance Officer, the cost of such repairs and corrective
action shall constitute a debt in favor of the City against the owner of the
repaired structure. In the event such owner fails, neglects or refuses to pay
the City the amount of this debt, the City shall certify the cost and expense
of repairs to the County Auditor and the same shall become a lien upon the real
estate.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.11 CORRECTIVE ACTION; CONDEMNATION.
   Any dwelling or structure shall be designated as unfit for human habitation
when any of the following defects or conditions are found, and when, in the
judgment of the Property Maintenance Officer, such defects create a hazard to
the health, safety or welfare of the occupants or of the public:
   (a)   The dwelling or structure is damaged, decayed, dilapidated,
unsanitary, unsafe and/or vermin-infested and/or contains hazardous levels of
lead-based paint or any other substance.
   (b)   The dwelling or structure lacks illumination, ventilation and/or
required sanitation facilities.
   (c)   The general condition of the occupied premises is unsanitary, unsafe
and/or unhealthful.
    Whenever any dwelling or premises has been designated as unfit for human
habitation, the Property Maintenance Officer shall placard the dwelling or
premises, indicating that it is unfit for human habitation. If the dwelling or
premises are subsequently occupied, the Property Maintenance Officer shall
order the dwelling or premises vacated within a reasonable time.
    Any dwelling or premises which have been designated as unfit for human
habitation or use shall not again be used without written approval from the
Property Maintenance Officer. The Property Maintenance Officer shall remove
such designation whenever the defects that resulted in condemnation have been
eliminated.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.12 CORRECTIVE ACTION; DEMOLITION.
   The Property Maintenance Officer shall order a dwelling or structure to be
demolished if it has been designated as unfit for human habitation, has been
placarded as such, has been vacated, has not been put into proper repair so as
to rescind the designation as unfit for human habitation and to cause the
placard to be removed, and is determined by the Property Maintenance Officer
not to warrant repair under Section
1472.10.
   The owner of any dwelling or structure which has been ordered to be
demolished shall be given notice of this order in the manner provided for
service of notice in Section
1472.08 and shall be given a reasonable time, not to exceed thirty days, to
demolish such structure.
    Any owner aggrieved by the notice to demolish may, within fourteen days,
seek a hearing in the manner provided in Section
1472.13.
   When the owner fails, neglects or refuses to demolish an unfit, unsafe or
unsanitary dwelling or structure within the requisite time, the Property
Maintenance Officer may apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for a
demolition order. The costs and expense of such action shall be certified to
the County Auditor to be assessed against the property and thereby made a lien
upon real estate.
    Whenever a dwelling or structure is demolished, whether carried out by the
owner or by the City, such demolition shall include the filling in of the
excavation on which the demolished dwelling or structure was located in such a
manner as to eliminate all potential danger to the public health, safety or
welfare arising from such excavation.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.13 APPEALS.
   (a)   There is hereby created a Property Maintenance Appeals Board
consisting of five members, who shall be appointed by the Mayor for overlapping
terms of three years.
(Ord. 2013-007. Passed 1-7-13.)
   (b)   Members of the Board shall be citizens of the United States and
residents of the City and shall serve without compensation. The Board shall
adopt procedures as it deems necessary to carry out the intent of this Code and
all decisions and findings shall be made part of the public record.
   (c)   Any person aggrieved by a notice of the Property Maintenance Officer
issued in connection with any alleged violation of this Code or of any
applicable rules issued pursuant thereto, or by any order requiring repair or
demolition, may apply to the Property Maintenance Appeals Board for a
reconsideration of such notice or order, provided that such application is made
within fourteen days after the date the notice or order was issued, upon a form
and in such manner as required by the Board. Such application shall be
accompanied by a deposit of fifteen dollars ($15.00).
   (d)   The Property Maintenance Appeals Board, upon the receipt of an appeal,
shall set a time and place for the hearing within ten days of the receipt of
the application and shall advise the applicant in writing of such time and
place at least seven days prior to the date of the hearing.
   (e)   At such a hearing the applicant shall be given an opportunity to be
heard and to show cause why such notice or order should be modified, extended
or withdrawn or why a variance should be granted.
   (f)   The Property Maintenance Appeals Board, by a majority vote, may
sustain, modify or withdraw any notice or order. In granting extensions or
variances of any notice or order, the Appeals Board may consider the following
conditions:
      (1)   That there are practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships in
carrying out the strict letter of any notice or order; and
      (2)   That such an extension or variance is in harmony with the general
purpose and intent of this Code in securing the public health, safety and
general welfare.
   (g)   The Appeals Board shall also have authority to hear appeals from
decisions of the Property Maintenance Officer in applying the policy that
structures that have been altered to increase the number of dwelling units will
be divided into three categories:
      (1)   Structures that are shown to have been altered before 1942 and
structures that have had City approval for alteration will be automatically
approved upon submission of an application and fee.
      (2)   Structures that are shown to have been altered between 1942 and
1985 will be subject to approval and conditions set at a public hearing of the
Property Maintenance Appeals Board. The Appeals Board shall use criteria that
were in effect prior to 1985 and a common sense approach to approval.
      (3)   Owners of structures that are shown to have been altered after 1985
must appear before the Planning Commission at both a public hearing and a
conditional use hearing. The conditions of the Zoning Code must be met.
Additional approval of the Board of Zoning Appeals may be required if sub-
standard conditions exist.
         (Ord. 1993-38. Passed 6-7-93.)
1472.14 EMERGENCIES.
   Whenever, in the judgment of the Property Maintenance Officer, an emergency
exists which requires immediate action to protect the public health, safety or
welfare, an order may be issued, without a hearing or appeal, directing the
owner, occupant, operator or agent of real property to take such action as is
appropriate to correct or abate the emergency. If circumstances warrant, the
Property Maintenance Officer may act to correct or abate the emergency.
   The owner, occupant, operator or agent of real property shall be granted a
hearing before the Property Maintenance Appeals Board on the matter upon his or
her request, as soon as practicable, but such appeal shall in no case stay the
abatement or correction of such emergency.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1472.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever continues in violation of any provision of this Code except Section
1472.03 after the time allowed for the correction of an alleged violation is
guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree and shall be fined not more than
five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned not more than sixty days, or both,
for each offense. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during
which a violation continues.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92; Ord. 2021-035. Passed 6-7-21.)
 
CHAPTER 1474
Responsibilities of Owners and Occupants
1474.01   Responsibilities of owners.
1474.02   Responsibilities of occupants.

1476
 
1474.01 RESPONSIBILITIES OF OWNERS.
   (a)   Every owner, operator or agent shall be responsible for providing,
supplying and maintaining all equipment, facilities and sanitary standards as
required by this Code.
   (b)   The total capacity of all provided garbage and/or refuse cans and bulk
storage containers shall be sufficient to meet the needs of the occupants of
the dwelling.
   (c)   The owner or operator of a residential rental dwelling unit shall be
responsible for installing all screens, storm doors and windows whenever the
same are required under the provisions of this Code or any rule adopted
pursuant thereto, except where there is a written agreement between the owner
and occupant. In the absence of such an agreement, maintenance or replacement
of screens, storm doors and windows, once installed in any one season, becomes
the responsibility of the occupant.
   (d)   Every owner of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall provide and maintain
the dwelling or dwelling unit free from hazards to health due to the presence
of toxic substances, e.g. lead-based paint.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1474.02 RESPONSIBILITIES OF OCCUPANTS.
   (a)   Every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall maintain in a
clean and sanitary condition that part or those parts of the dwelling, dwelling
unit and premises that he or she occupies and controls.
   (b)   Every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall store and dispose
of all of his or her rubbish in a clean, sanitary and safe manner.
   (c)   Every occupant of a dwelling containing a single dwelling unit shall
be responsible for the extermination of insects and/or rats on the premises,
and every occupant of a dwelling unit in a dwelling containing more than one
dwelling unit shall be responsible for such extermination whenever his or her
dwelling is the only one infested.
   (d)   Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this section, whenever
infestation is caused by failure of the owner to maintain a dwelling in a
ratproof or reasonably insectproof condition, extermination shall be the
responsibility of the owner. Whenever infestation exists in two or more of the
dwelling units in any dwelling, or in the shared or public parts of any
dwelling containing two or more dwelling units, extermination thereof shall be
the responsibility of the owner.
   (e)   Every occupant of a dwelling unit shall keep all supplied fixtures and
facilities therein in a clean, sanitary and operable condition and shall
exercise reasonable care in the proper use and operation thereof.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1476
Housing License Requirements
1476.01   Operation of rental dwellings, etc.; license required.
1476.02   Effective period of license; renewal; transfer.
1476.03   License issuance; compliance with Code required.
1476.04   Agreement re inspections.
1476.05   Application and license fee.
1476.06   Notice of license and license contents to tenants.
1476.07   Notice of violations.
1476.08   Reinspections; license suspension.
1476.09   Reconsideration of license suspension.
1476.10   Revolving Loan Fund.

1476.01 OPERATION OF RENTAL DWELLINGS, ETC.; LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, partnership, corporation or other legal entity shall operate a
residential rental dwelling, rooming house or dormitory unless he or she holds
a current, unrevoked housing license issued by the City of Ravenna.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1476.02 EFFECTIVE PERIOD OF LICENSE; RENEWAL; TRANSFER.
   Every housing license shall be issued for a period of two years from its
date of issuance unless sooner revoked, and may be renewed for successive
periods of not to exceed two years. The housing license shall be permitted to
be transferred to a new owner or operator within thirty days of transfer or
other legal disposal of a residential rental dwelling, rooming house or
dormitory dwelling.
(Ord. 1997-111. Passed 8-4-97; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.03 LICENSE ISSUANCE; COMPLIANCE WITH CODE REQUIRED.
   (a)   The City of Ravenna is hereby authorized upon application therefor, to
issue new housing licenses and renewals thereof in the names of applicant
owners or operators of residential rental dwellings, rooming houses or
dormitories. No such licenses shall be issued unless the residential rental
dwelling, rooming house or dormitory in connection with which the license is
sought is found, after inspection, to meet all applicable requirements of this
Code and applicable rules issued pursuant thereto.
   (b)   If the owner, occupant, or agent thereof does not consent to the
proposed inspection, the code official may appear before any judge in a court
of competent jurisdiction and seek an administrative search warrant to allow an
inspection. Any such application shall be made within ten calendar days after
the non-consent. The application for the warrant shall specify the basis upon
which the warrant is being sought and shall include a statement that the
inspection will be limited to a determination whether there are violations of
the code provisions identified in this section. The court may consider any of
the following factors along with such other matters as it deems pertinent in
its decision as to whether a warrant shall be issued:
      (1)   Eyewitness account of violation;
      (2)   Citizen complaints;
      (3)   Tenant complaints;
      (4)   Plain view violations;
      (5)   Violations apparent from City records;
      (6)   Property deterioration;
      (7)   Age of property;
      (8)   Nature of alleged violation.
   (c)   If a warrant is issued, no owner, occupant, or agent thereof shall
fail or neglect, upon presentation of a warrant, to properly permit entry
therein by the code official or his/her duly authorized designee for the
purpose of conducting a rental inspection and examination pursuant to this
section and consistent with the terms of the warrant. If the court declines to
issue a warrant, or if no warrant is sought, the rental inspection will not
take place and no certificate will be issued.
      (1)   If an administrative order is ignored, the City will file through
the court for a motion of contempt.
      (2)   If a warrant is issued and upon inspection violation(s) found, the
City may petition the court for administrative expenses incurred with
appropriate expenses awarded to the City. Expenses incurred may be but are not
limited to staff wages per hour, court cost, inspection fees and other costs
associated with seeking the administrative warrant.
         (Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.04 AGREEMENT RE INSPECTIONS.
   (a)   No housing license shall be issued or renewed unless the applicant
owner or operator agrees in his or her application to such inspections,
pursuant to Section
1472.01, as the City of Ravenna may require to determine whether the
residential rental dwelling, rooming house or dormitory, in connection with
which such license is sought, is in compliance with the applicable provisions
of this Code and with applicable rules issued pursuant thereto.
   (b)   The fee for the third, and subsequent re-inspections shall be fifty
dollars ($50.00).
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92; Ord. 2006-196. Passed 2-5-2007.)
1476.05 APPLICATION AND LICENSE FEE.
   (a)   All new rental applications will require a one hundred dollar
($100.00) application fee per property owner or owner’s agent. Separate parcels
require a separate application and fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00). No
housing license shall be issued or renewed unless the completed application
form is accompanied by payment of a permit fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) per
unit with a minimum fee of forty dollars ($40.00).
   (b)   Each subsequent inspection, after a failure of the initial inspection,
there shall be a fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per unit.
(Ord. 2011-094. Passed 8-1-11; Ord. 2011-159. Passed 10-3-11; Ord. 2019-056.
Passed 5-6-19; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.06 NOTICE OF LICENSE AND LICENSE CONTENTS TO TENANTS.
   It shall be the responsibility of the owner or operator of a residential
rental dwelling, rooming house or dormitory dwelling to give notice of his or
her housing license with the City to tenants by one of the following authorized
methods:
   (a)   Displaying the license or a copy thereof in a conspicuous place in the
common ways of a multifamily dwelling.
   (b)   Placing in all written rental agreements a notice indicating the valid
time period and number of occupants.
   (c)   Providing a written notice, separate from a written rental agreement,
indicating the valid time period and number of occupants.
   The valid time period and number of occupants shall be from information
appearing on the housing license.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.07 NOTICE OF VIOLATIONS.
   Whenever, upon inspection of a residential rental dwelling, rooming house or
dormitory, the City of Ravenna finds that conditions or practices exist which
are in violation of the provisions of this Code or of any applicable rules
issued pursuant thereto, the owner or operator thereof shall be served with
notice of such violation in the manner provided in Section
1472.08. Such notice shall state that unless the violations cited are corrected
within a reasonable time, the housing license may be suspended.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1476.08 REINSPECTIONS; LICENSE SUSPENSION.
   At the end of the time allowed for correction of any violation cited, the
City of Ravenna shall reinspect the dwelling and if it is determined that the
violation has not been corrected may issue an order suspending the housing
license.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1476.09 RECONSIDERATION OF LICENSE SUSPENSION.
   Any person whose permit to operate a dwelling has been suspended shall be
entitled to a reconsideration of the order by an administrative conference or
by an appeal to the Property Maintenance Code Appeals Board in the manner
provided in Section
1472.13.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1476.10 REVOLVING LOAN FUND.
   There is hereby created a Revolving Loan Fund for the purpose of supporting
the cost of repairs, corrective action or demolition associated with the
enforcement of this Code.
   The City is hereby directed to adopt plans for the creation and
administration of this fund.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1476.11 ANNUAL REGISTRATION.
   An owner or operator of every residential rental dwelling, rooming house or
dormitory dwelling shall, annually, file a registration with the City of
Ravenna, unless a housing license, pursuant to the provisions of this chapter,
has been issued for the same dwelling within one year. Should the owner or
operator of a residential rental dwelling, rooming house, or dormitory dwelling
refuse to participate in the rental inspection program, they shall complete the
opt-out form provided from the Building Department and return the form to the
Building Department within seven days.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.12 CHANGES IN RENTAL/CHANGES IN OWNERSHIP.
   An owner may remove their property from being a residential rental dwelling,
rooming house or dormitory dwelling by submitting an affidavit, bearing their
notarized signature to the Property Maintenance Official. However, this
property will be required to have a new Rental Housing Occupancy Certificate
granted prior to re- renting. All inspection fees will apply, even if the
previous certificate has not expired.
(Ord. 2011-095. Passed 8-1-11; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
1476.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    It is the duty of the applicant to renew their residential rental
dwelling, rooming house or dormitory dwelling property(s) on a two (2) year
basis by contacting the Property Maintenance Official prior to the Rental
Housing Occupancy Certificate expiring and completing a successful inspection
of renewal prior to expiration. If such application and successful inspection
is not completed by the month of the expiration date of the current
certificate, an additional one hundred dollar ($100.00) fee shall be paid along
with the applicable permit fee. The Rental Housing Occupancy Certificate will
be revoked due to nonpayment of fees and an additional fee of one hundred
dollars ($100.00) shall be paid as part of the new application fee, prior to a
Rental Housing Occupancy Certificate being granted after reinspection.
   (b)   If the City of Ravenna discovers that the property is an unregistered
rental property, an additional fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be
due in addition to all other applicable fees. If payment has not been received
within thirty (30) days of notification by the City, and court action is taken
to collect the applicable fee(s), an additional fee of one hundred dollars
($100.00) will be required. This fee will be required over and above any court
fees that are charged.
(Ord. 2011-095. Passed 8-1-11; Ord. 2021-036. Passed 6-7-21.)
 
CHAPTER 1478
Basic Equipment and Facilities
1478.01   Compliance required.
1478.02   Kitchens.
1478.03   Bathrooms.
1478.04   Egress.
1478.05   Handrails and guardrails.
1478.06   Private access and egress.
1478.07   Locks on exterior doors.
1478.08   Rubbish and garbage storage facilities and services.
1478.09   Fire extinguishers; smoke detectors.
1478.10   Carbon monoxide detectors.
1478.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Environmental nuisances - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
626
Littering - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
634
Filthy accumulations; polluting and diverting watercourses - see GEN. OFF.

660.06
Garbage and rubbish - see S.U. & P.S. Chs.

1062; B. & H.

1476

1650.07
1478.01 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No person shall occupy as owner or occupant, or let to another for
occupancy, any dwelling or dwelling unit, for the purpose of living, sleeping,
cooking or eating therein, which dwelling or dwelling unit does not comply with
the requirements of this chapter.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.02 KITCHENS.
   Every dwelling unit shall have a room or portion of a room in which food may
be prepared and/or cooked, which shall have an adequate circulation area and a
kitchen sink in good working condition and properly connected to a water supply
system which is approved by the City of Ravenna, which provides at all times an
adequate amount of heated and unheated running water under pressure, and which
is connected to a sewer system approved by the City of Ravenna.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.03 BATHROOMS.
   Every dwelling unit shall be provided with a room affording privacy and
equipped with a flush water closet, a lavatory basin and a bathtub or shower in
good working condition and connected to a water supply and sewer system in an
approved manner.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.04 EGRESS.
   (a)   All dwellings shall have a safe, unobstructed means of egress with a
minimum headroom of six feet, six inches leading to safe and open space at
ground level.
    (b)   All exits, including exit stairways, shall be kept in a reasonably
good state of repair. Floors, treads and risers must be sound and furnish a
reasonably smooth surface. Risers of unequal height, broken tread noses,
structurally unsafe surfaces, excessive warping, holes and cracks all
constitute serious safety hazards. Doors must be readily operable from the
inside as well as the outside. Each exit shall be kept unobstructed at all
times.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
1478.05 HANDRAILS AND GUARDRAILS.
   (a)   Structurally sound handrails shall be provided on any steps containing
four risers or more. Porches, patios and/or balconies located more than three
feet higher than the adjacent area shall have structurally sound protective
guardrails or handrails. Porches and/or balcony handrails shall have balusters
no more than six inches apart and shall be constructed in an approved manner.
   (b)   No handrail shall be less than thirty inches vertically above the nose
of the stair tread or less than forty-two inches above stairway platforms.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.06 PRIVATE ACCESS AND EGRESS.
   Access to or egress from each dwelling unit shall be provided without
passing through any other dwelling unit.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.07 LOCKS ON EXTERIOR DOORS.
   All exterior doors shall be equipped with safe and functioning locking
devices.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1478.08 RUBBISH AND GARBAGE STORAGE FACILITIES AND SERVICES.
   Each dwelling unit shall be supplied with adequate rubbish and garbage
storage facilities approved by the City of Ravenna. Each owner and/or operator
of each rental facility, unit or structure shall provide adequate rubbish and
garbage services on a weekly basis to each unit rented.
(Ord. 2025-040. Passed 4-7-25.)
1478.09 FIRE EXTINGUISHERS; SMOKE DETECTORS.
   (a)   Every rental dwelling unit structure shall be equipped with fire
extinguishers of a classification required by the National Fire Protection
Association. (See also Sections
1472.08 et seq.).
   (b)   All dwelling units shall be equipped with audible smoke detector
devices that are UL approved and installed in compliance with standards of the
National Fire Protection Association.
      (1)   On the ceiling or wall outside of each separate sleeping area in
the immediate vicinity of bedrooms.
      (2)   In each room used for sleeping purposes.
      (3)   In each story within a dwelling unit, including basements, and
cellars but not including crawl spaces and uninhabitable attics. In dwellings
or dwelling units with split levels and without an intervening door between the
adjacent levels, a smoke alarm installed on the upper level shall suffice for
the adjacent lower level provided that the lower level is less than one full
story below the upper level.
         (Ord. 2007-014. Passed 4-2-07.)
1478.10   CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
   (a)   Every rental dwelling unit within which fuel burning appliances are
present, that utilizes fuel burning appliances for the heating of a dwelling
unit or units, or within a dwelling unit that is located in a structure with an
attached garage, shall be equipped with carbon monoxide detectors, that are UL
approved and installed in compliance with OFC § 915.
      (1)   Installed outside of each separate sleeping area in immediate
vicinity of each sleeping area.
      (2)   Installed on each story of the dwelling, including basements, and
sellers, but not including crawlspaces and uninhabitable attics. In dwellings
or dwelling units with split levels, a carbon monoxide detector shall be
installed on each level.
      (3)   The occupants of any dwelling unit shall be responsible for
replacing the battery and battery-operated carbon monoxide detectors.
      (4)   The property owner shall be responsible for all maintenance of
carbon monoxide detectors other than battery replacement. No person shall
remove or render a carbon monoxide detector in operation.
      (5)   The new code provisions set forth specific parameters that each
must meet, including they must be listed and they must be maintained in
accordance with applicable NFPA standards (i.e., 2015 NFPA 720). See OFC §§
915.3 - 915.6. (See also Sections 1742.08 et seq.)
   (b)   Definitions.
      (1)   "Carbon monoxide detector" means a device which detects the
presence of carbon monoxide, and which emits audible and visual signals,
indicating the presence of unhealthy or lethal levels of carbon monoxide.
      (2)   "Fuel-burning appliance" means a device, apparatus, furnace,
fireplace, or a boiler that bums coal, wood, charcoal, oil, kerosene, propane,
natural gas, or fossil fuels, and that produces carbon monoxide as a
combustible by-product.
         (Ord. 2023-020. Passed 3-6-23.)
1478.99 PENALTY.
   If the City of Ravenna discovers that the property does not have a contract
with a rubbish and or garbage hauler per Section 1478.08, the City shall charge
the owner or operator a fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) per month until
the owner or operator establishes that they have a weekly service provider for
the pick-up of trash and rubbish. This fee may be assessed to the property
taxes of the parcel served.
(Ord. 2025-040. Passed 4-7-25.)
 
CHAPTER 1480
Minimum Standards for Light and Ventilation
1480.01   Windows; skylights.

1480.05   Ventilating of attics and enclosed basementless spaces.

1480.01 WINDOWS; SKYLIGHTS.
   Every habitable room shall have at least one window or ventilating skylight
facing directly to the outdoors.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1480.02 VENTILATION.
   Every habitable space shall have at least one window or skylight which can
be easily opened or such other device that will adequately ventilate the room.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1480.03 BATHROOM VENTILATION AND LIGHTING.
   Every bathroom and water closet compartment shall comply with the light and
ventilation requirements for habitable spaces as required in Sections
1480.01 and
1480.02, except that a window shall not be required in bathrooms with water
closet compartments equipped with an approved mechanical ventilation system.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1480.04 ELECTRICAL REQUIREMENTS.
   Every building used for occupancy shall be adequately and safely provided
with an electrical system. The provisions of this section shall be considered
the absolute minimum. However, the size of the unit and the usage of appliances
and equipment shall be the basis for determining the need for additional
facilities. All outlets and fixtures shall be properly installed, maintained in
good and safe working order and connected to a source of electrical power in a
safe, approved manner.
   (a)   Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with at least sixty-ampere
service.
   (b)   Temporary wiring or extension cords shall not be used as permanent
wiring.
   (c)   Every non-habitable room, including water closet compartments,
bathrooms, laundry rooms, furnace rooms and public halls shall contain at least
one supplied ceiling or wall-type electric light fixture.
   (d)   All electric lights and outlets in bathrooms shall be controlled by
switches which are of such design as shall minimize the danger of electric
shock, and such lights and outlets shall be installed and maintained in such
condition as to minimize the danger of electrical shock. At least one
receptacle of the grounding type shall be installed for connection of laundry
appliances. All receptacles exposed to the outdoors shall be of the grounding
type.
      (Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1480.05 VENTILATING OF ATTICS AND ENCLOSED BASEMENTLESS SPACES.
   Natural ventilation of spaces such as attics and enclosed basementless
spaces shall be provided with openings of sufficient size to overcome dampness
and minimize the effect of conditions conducive to decay and deterioration of
the structure and to prevent excessive heat.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1482
Minimum Thermal Standards
1482.01   Heating facilities required.
1482.02   Installation and use of heating facilities.
 
CROSS REFERENCES

1482.01 HEATING FACILITIES REQUIRED.
   Every dwelling shall have heating equipment and appurtenances which are
properly installed, maintained in safe and good working condition and capable
of safely and adequately heating all habitable rooms, bathrooms and water
closet compartments in every dwelling unit.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1482.02 INSTALLATION AND USE OF HEATING FACILITIES.
   (a)   No owner or occupant shall install, operate or use a heating device,
including hot water heating units, which employs the combustion of carbonaceous
fuel, which is not vented to the outside of the structure in an approved
manner, and which is not supplied with sufficient air to continuously support
the combustion of the fuel. All heating devices shall be constructed, installed
and operated in such a manner as to minimize accidental burns.
   (b)   Heat ducts, steam pipes and hot water pipes in supplied central
heating systems are to be free of leaks.
   (c)   Seals between sections of hot-air furnaces which are integral parts of
central heating systems are to be tight enough to prevent the escape of noxious
gases through the heat ducts.
   (d)   Portable space heaters, if used, must be UL approved and operate per
the manufacturer's specifications.
   (e)   Space heaters which operate by a combustion process shall be properly
vented to a chimney or duct leading to the outdoors.
   (f)   Coal or wood-burning space heaters shall have a fire-resistant panel
beneath them.
   (g)   Space heaters located within two feet of a wall shall be adequately
insulated to prevent overheating of the wall per the manufacturer's
specifications.
   (h)   Space heaters with smoke pipes shall be equipped with guards, made of
a non-flammable material at the point where the pipe goes through a wall,
ceiling or partition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1484
Occupancy Standards
1484.01   Compliance required.
1484.02   Space requirements.
1484.03   Number of persons per dwelling unit.
1484.04   Ceiling height.

CROSS REFERENCES

626
Littering - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
634
Filthy accumulations; polluting and diverting watercourses - see GEN. OFF.

1484.01 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No person shall occupy or let to be occupied any dwelling or dwelling unit,
for the purpose of living therein, unless there is compliance with the
requirements of this chapter.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.02 SPACE REQUIREMENTS.
   Each dwelling unit shall have the space necessary to provide suitable
living, sleeping, cooking and dining accommodations and storage and sanitary
facilities, as well as space of such size and dimensions as to permit placement
of furniture and essential equipment.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.03 NUMBER OF PERSONS PER DWELLING UNIT.
   Not more than one family, plus two occupants unrelated to the family, except
for guests or domestic employees, shall occupy a dwelling unit unless a license
for a rooming house has been granted by the City of Ravenna.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.04 CEILING HEIGHT.
   The ceiling height of any habitable room shall be at least seven feet, six
inches, except that in any habitable room under a sloping ceiling at least one-
half of the floor area shall have a ceiling height of at least seven feet, six
inches.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.05 BASEMENTS AND CELLARS.
   No basement or cellar space shall be used as a habitable room or a dwelling
unit unless:
   (a)   The floor and walls are impervious to leakage of underground and
surface run-off water and are insulated against dampness;
   (b)   The total operable window area in each room is equal to at least the
minimum required by Section
1480.02;
   (c)   The required minimum area is located entirely above grade of the
ground adjoining such window area;
   (d)   When occupied for living, it meets all the minimum standards and
requirements of this Code;
   (e)   Furnace and domestic hot water facilities are completely separated
from the habitable areas by the installation of fire-rated materials in an
approved manner;
   (f)   Adequate makeup air is provided in an approved manner; and
   (g)   Two means of egress shall be provided, in accordance with the
requirements of Section
1478.04. The second means of egress may be a window whose area shall be at
least 5.75 square feet, located not more than forty-four inches off the floor.
      (Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.06 BATHROOM ACCESS.
   No dwelling or dwelling unit containing two or more sleeping rooms shall
have such room arrangements that access to a bathroom or water closet
compartment intended for use by occupants of more than one sleeping room can be
had only by going through another sleeping room, nor shall room arrangements be
such that access to a sleeping room can be had only by going through another
sleeping room. A bathroom or water closet compartment shall not be used as the
only passageway to any habitable room, hall, basement or cellar or to the
exterior of the dwelling unit.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1484.07 CLOSETS.
   Every dwelling unit shall have adequate closet space for the personal
effects of the occupants.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1486
Safety and Sanitation Requirements for Maintenance of Parts of Dwellings and
Dwelling Units
1486.01   Structural design generally.
1486.02   Interior surfaces.
1486.03   Landscaping.

1486.07   Installation of piping, equipment and utilities.
1486.08   Construction and materials; egress; installation and use of
equipment.
1486.09   Fire escapes.
 
CROSS REFERENCES

1486.01 STRUCTURAL DESIGN GENERALLY.
   Every foundation, roof, floor, exterior and interior wall, ceiling, inside
and outside stair, porch, and every appurtenance thereto, shall be safe to use,
capable of supporting the loads that normal use may cause to be placed thereon
and kept in sound condition and good repair. Every inside and outside stair or
step shall have safe uniform risers and safe uniform treads.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.02 INTERIOR SURFACES.
   Floors, walls, windows, doors, ceilings and other interior surfaces shall be
maintained in good, clean and sanitary condition. Peeling paint, cracked or
loose plaster, decayed wood and other defective surface conditions shall be
eliminated.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.03 LANDSCAPING.
   Every premises shall be graded, drained, free of standing water, planted to
deter erosion and maintained in a clean, sanitary and safe condition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.04 SCREENING.
   (a)   During that portion of the year when it is necessary for protection
against insects, every door and window or other outside opening used for
ventilation purposes shall be supplied with approved, tight-fitting screens of
not less than sixteen mesh per inch and every swinging screen door shall have a
self-closing device is good working order.
   (b)   Screen doors shall not be required for outswinging doors or other
types of openings which make screening impractical.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.05 INFESTATION; EXTERMINATION.
   (a)   All structures and premises shall be kept free from insect and rat
infestation, and where insects or rats are found they shall be promptly
exterminated by approved methods which are not injurious to human health.
   (b)   All windows located at or near ground level that are used or intended
to be used for ventilation, all other openings located at or near ground level,
and all exterior doorways which might provide an entry for rats, shall be
supplied with adequate screens or such other devices as will effectively
prevent the entrance of rats into the structure.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.06 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND PIPING; FLOOR SURFACES.
   Every plumbing fixture and all water and waste pipes shall be properly
installed and maintained in good and sanitary working condition.
   Every water closet compartment, bathroom and kitchen floor surface shall be
constructed and maintained so as to be reasonably impervious to water and so as
to permit such floor to be easily kept in a clean and sanitary condition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.07 INSTALLATION OF PIPING, EQUIPMENT AND UTILITIES.
   All plumbing, every chimney, flue and smoke pipe, and every other facility,
piece of equipment or utility which is present in a dwelling or dwelling unit,
or which is required under this Code, shall be constructed and installed in
conformance with the appropriate statutes, ordinances and regulations of the
City of Ravenna and the State of Ohio.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.08 CONSTRUCTION AND MATERIALS; EGRESS; INSTALLATION AND USE OF EQUIPMENT.
   All construction and materials, ways and means of egress, and installation
and use of equipment, shall conform to the appropriate statutes, ordinances and
regulations of the City of Ravenna and the State of Ohio relating to fire
prevention.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1486.09 FIRE ESCAPES.
   Fire escapes, where required or installed, shall be kept in good order and
repair and shall be reasonably protected from deterioration by paint or other
approved methods.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1488
Exterior Property Maintenance
RESIDENTIAL STRUCTURES

660.06

1060,

Housing license requirements - see B. & H. Ch.
1476 
 
RESIDENTIAL STRUCTURES
 
1488.01 OFFENSIVE OR HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS PROHIBITED.
   No owner, agent or occupant of any premises shall maintain or permit to be
maintained at or on the exterior property areas of such premises any condition
which deteriorates or debases the appearance of the neighborhood or creates a
fire, safety or health hazard or is a public nuisance.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.02 MAINTENANCE OF EXTERIORS GENERALLY.
   The exterior of premises and all structures thereon shall be kept free of
all nuisances and any hazards to the safety of occupants, pedestrians and
persons utilizing the premises, and free of unsanitary conditions, and all of
the foregoing shall be promptly removed and abated by the owner or occupant of
the premises or structure.
   Any structure or accessory structure whose exterior surface is deteriorated,
or whose surface is weathered with dirt and grime or has been impaired through
peeling or flaking of the paint or other protective coating, shall be cleaned,
repaired, painted, resurfaced or replaced as follows: all buckled, rotted or
decayed walls, doors, windows, porches, floors, steps, railings, soffits,
posts, sills, trim and their missing members shall be replaced and put in good
condition; all exterior unfinished surfaces shall be sealed and painted and
such sealant and paint must conform to and match the existing surface covering
or paint and the original design or replacement thereof; all exterior walls and
surfaces shall be properly protected against the weather, where the same are
defective or lack weather protection, including lack of paint or surface
covering, or have weathered due to lack of proper protective covering; all
exterior surfaces shall be replaced or repaired in good condition preparatory
to repainting or coating; all bare exterior surfaces which are flaking or
crumbling shall be replaced or sealed in a good and workmanlike manner, and all
new or repaired bare surfaces shall be painted or coated.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.03 FOUNDATIONS.
   All foundation walls shall be maintained so as to carry the safe design and
operating dead and live loads for which they are designed and shall be
maintained plumb and free from open cracks and breaks, so as not to be
detrimental to public safety and welfare.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.04 STAIRS, PORCHES AND BALCONIES.
   Every stair, porch, balcony and all appurtenances attached thereto shall be
kept in sound condition and good repair so as to be safe to use and capable of
supporting the loads to which they are subjected.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.05 ROOFS, GUTTERS AND DOWNSPOUTS.
   All roofs of every dwelling structure shall be maintained weathertight. Roof
drainage shall be adequate to prevent rain water from causing dampness or
deterioration in the walls or interior portion of the structure. Roof water
shall not be discharged in a manner that creates a nuisance to owners or
occupants of adjacent premises.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.06 MAINTENANCE AND REPLACEMENT OF DEFECTIVE STRUCTURAL COMPONENTS.
   (a)   All buckled, rotted or decayed walls, doors, windows, porches, floors,
steps, trim, railings and their missing members, must be replaced and put in
good condition. All replacements must be permanent and must match or be
compatible with the rest of the structure.
   (b)   Structures shall be maintained free of broken or cracked windows,
crumbling stone or brick or other conditions reflective of deterioration or
inadequate maintenance.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.07 HANDRAILS AND GUARDRAILS.
   Every handrail and guardrail shall be firmly fastened, capable of safely
supported intended live loads and maintained in good condition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.08 INFESTATION.
   All dwelling structures and the premises thereof shall be maintained free
from sources of breeding, harborage and infestation by insects, vermin or
rodents.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.09 STORAGE OF COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL MATERIAL.
   No person shall store or use at a location visible from a sidewalk, street
or other public area, equipment and materials relating to commercial or
industrial uses, unless specifically permitted under the provisions of the
Zoning Code of the City of Ravenna.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
NONRESIDENTIAL STRUCTURES
1488.10 OFFENSIVE OR HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS PROHIBITED.
   No owner, agent or occupant of any nonresidential premises shall maintain or
permit to be maintained at or on the exterior property areas of such premises
any condition which deteriorates or debases the appearance of the neighborhood
or creates a fire, safety or health hazard or is a public nuisance.
   The owner shall be responsible for ensuring that premises are maintained in
good repair and appearance in compliance with this Code. Occupants shall be
responsible for maintaining in a clean and sanitary condition those premises or
portions thereof which they occupy and/or control.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.11 MAINTENANCE OF EXTERIORS GENERALLY.
   The exterior of premises and all structures thereon shall be kept free of
all nuisances and any hazards to the safety of occupants, pedestrians and
persons utilizing the premises, and free of unsanitary conditions, and all of
the foregoing shall be promptly removed and abated by the owner or occupant of
the premises or structure.
   Any structure or accessory structure whose exterior surface is deteriorated,
or whose surface is weathered with dirt and grime or has been impaired through
peeling or flaking of the paint or other protective coating, shall be cleaned,
repaired, painted, resurfaced or replaced as follows: all buckled, rotted or
decayed walls, doors, windows, porches, floors, steps, railings, soffits,
posts, sills, trim and their missing members shall be replaced and put in good
condition; all exterior unfinished surfaces shall be sealed and painted and
such sealant and paint must conform to and match the existing surface covering
or paint and the original design or replacement thereof; all exterior walls and
surfaces shall be properly protected against the weather, where the same are
defective or lack weather protection, including lack of paint or surface
covering, or have weathered due to lack of proper protective covering; all
exterior surfaces shall be replaced or repaired in good condition preparatory
to repainting or coating; all bare exterior surfaces which are flaking or
crumbling shall be replaced or sealed in a good and workmanlike manner; and all
new or repaired bare surfaces shall be painted or coated.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.12 HANDRAILS AND GUARDRAILS ON STAIRS, LANDINGS AND PORCHES.
   All stairs, landings and porches shall be provided with handrails or
guardrails properly maintained to minimize the hazard of falling and shall be
kept structurally sound, in good repair and free from defects.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.13 AWNINGS, MARQUEES AND SIGNS.
   Any awning, marquee or sign and its accompanying structured members shall be
maintained in good repair and shall not constitute a nuisance or a safety
hazard. In the event that such awnings, marquees or signs are not properly
maintained in accordance with the foregoing, they shall, together with their
supporting members, be removed forthwith. In the event that such awnings,
marquees or signs are made of cloth, plastic, metal or similar materials, such
cloth, plastic, metal or similar materials shall be maintained in good
condition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.14 MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF EXTERIOR SURFACES.
   The exterior of every structure or accessory structure shall be kept in good
repair and painted. All surfaces shall be maintained free from broken or
cracked glass, loose shingles, crumbling stone or brick, excessive peeling
paint or any other condition reflective of deterioration or inadequate
maintenance.
   In the event that repairs become necessary, such repairs shall be made to
match and conform to the original design and materials and shall be
accomplished in a manner as to permanently repair the damaged area or areas.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.15 INFESTATION.
   All structures and the premises thereof shall be maintained free of vermin,
rodents and other pests, and free of sources of breeding, harborage and
infestation by such vermin, rodents and other pests. (See also Chapter
1486.05).
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
EXTERIOR PROPERTY AREAS
1488.16 UNSIGHTLY OR OFFENSIVE CONDITIONS AND ARTICLES PROHIBITED.
   No owner or occupant of any premises shall maintain or permit to be
maintained at or on the exterior property areas of such premises any of the
following:
   (a)   Broken or dilapidated fences, walls or other structures;
   (b)   Rugs, rags or other materials hung on lines, or in other places on the
premises, which materials are not being used for general household or
housekeeping purposes;
   (c)   Broken, dilapidated or unusable furniture, mattresses or other
household furniture, broken glass, plastic materials, paints, miscellaneous
covering, automobile parts and/or any other materials, including those
described in this section, placed at or on the premises in such a manner as to
be patently unsightly, grotesque or offensive to the senses.
      (Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.17 MAINTENANCE OF LAWNS AND LANDSCAPING.
   Lawns and landscaping on private property and within a public right of way
shall be kept from becoming overgrown and unsightly and shall be maintained so
as not to constitute a blighting or deteriorating influence on the surrounding
neighborhood. Grass is limited to a total height of eight inches (8").
(Ord. 2012-112. Passed 6-4-12.)
1488.18 DEAD TREES AND BRANCHES.
   No owner or occupant of any premises shall permit a dead tree to stand so
near to a public sidewalk or roadway as to endanger users thereof, should all
or part of it fall. No such owner or occupant shall permit a dead branch to
overhang a public sidewalk or roadway.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.19 PARKING LOTS, DRIVEWAYS AND DRIVEWAY APRONS.
   (a)   Parking lots shall be kept in a safe condition, free from chuckholes,
depressions, large cracks and disintegrated or deteriorated areas. Parking lots
which are not hard surfaced shall also be kept free from dust. Where necessary
for traffic safety, painted striping shall be provided and shall be visible and
maintained in good condition.
   (b)   Driveways and driveway aprons shall be kept in good repair and safe
condition.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.20 GARBAGE AND RUBBISH REMOVAL.
   No owner or occupant of any premises shall allow the accumulation of garbage
or rubbish. All such owners and occupants must provide for the storage and
collection of such garbage and rubbish in an approved manner. (See also Section
1478.08.)
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.21 FENCES.
   All fences shall be constructed of approved fencing material, shall be
maintained in good condition and shall not create a harborage for rats. Wood
material shall be protected against decay by use of paint which is not lead-
based or by other preservative material. The permissible height and other
characteristics of all fences shall conform to the appropriate statutes,
ordinances and regulations of the City of Ravenna.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
1488.22 ACCESSORY STRUCTURES.
   Accessory structures present or provided by the owner, agent or tenant
occupant on the premises of a dwelling shall be structurally sound, maintained
in good repair and free of insects and rats, or removed from the premises. The
exterior of such structures shall be made weather-resistant through the use of
decay-resistant materials or the use of lead-free paint or other preservative.
(Ord. 1992-16. Passed 4-6-92.)
 
CHAPTER 1490
Utilities
1490.01   Unauthorized removal, shut-off or discontinuance; notification of
water bill delinquency.
1490.02   Service for vacant and occupied structures.
 
CROSS REFERENCES

626

Filthy accumulations; polluting and diverting watercourses - see GEN. OFF.

660.06
Utilities generally - see S.U. & P.S. Chs.
1040 et seq.
Garbage and rubbish - see S.U. & P.S. Chs.

1062; B. & H.
